title: Trust Me (Rebroadcast)
description: Societies where people trust one another are healthier and wealthier. In the U.S. (and the U.K. and elsewhere), social trust has been falling for decades — in part because our populations are more diverse. What can we do to fix it?
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
